sort of like I mean who could know what

just being programmed came out of
turing's mind during this last very last

about it um in this art argument that's
known as the Turing test he proposed
that a computer that
could answer questions uh and be
indistinguishable to a judge from a real
person perhaps should be treated as a

at the argument in the abstract it looks
like an argument for computationalism
that computers and people are

which is you realize here's this person

having created this thought experiment
where he's saying should this weird
creature have right rights I think it
puts it in a very different light and I
think the right way to understand
Turing is to understand that this whole

possible situation very close to suicide
and that it amounted
to a flight from life but also a defense
